meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny! It's your favorite groovy game reviewer here, and I'm stoked to share my thoughts on Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 1 + 2. I mean, who wouldn't want to revisit the radness of the '90s with this remastered masterpiece?

Let me start by saying that I'm not a huge skateboarding enthusiast, but even I can appreciate the sheer awesomeness of THPS 1+2. The critics are raving about it – and for good reason! With IGN giving it a 90, GameSpot praising its accessibility and smooth gameplay (no load times to worry about!), and even Gaming Age doling out a perfect 100, it's clear that this game is a love letter to the original Tony Hawk fans.

Now, I'm no expert, but from my perspective as a reviewer who's all about having fun, THPS 1+2 delivers. The levels are lovingly designed odes to the past (Game Informer says so!), with contemporary visuals and smooth gameplay that'll keep you coming back for more (even if some of these challenges get a little too tricky, wink-wink). And let's not forget about the soundtrack – it's like an old childhood buddy embracing you!

Of course, no game is perfect, but I'm willing to overlook any minor gripes (like Worth Playing mentioning that there isn't much to do after clearing each stage in one afternoon) when everything else feels so nicely polished.

So, what's my verdict? Well, I'll leave it up to the experts like Cheat Code Central, who declared this remaster a "perfect" experience. SpazioGames summed it up perfectly: Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 1+2 is both nostalgic and modern – a blast from the past that feels fresh in the present.

That's all for now, folks! If you're as excited about this game as I am (and even if you're not), do yourself a favor and grab THPS 1+2. Your inner '90s kid will thank you!

Later, gamers!
